title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2021 that cover topics related to representing knowledge in both unstructured
note: raw text) and structured (graphs) formats, and guiding natural language generation (NLG) using external knowledge:

author.literal: **"Attention is All You Need"** - Vaswani et al.

title: Introduces the Transformer model, which has become foundational in NLG and knowledge representation
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
Discusses BERT, a model that has significantly impacted how raw text is processed and understood
**"GPT-3: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
Explores the capabilities of GPT-3 in generating natural language and leveraging external knowledge
**"Knowledge Graph Embedding: A Survey of Approaches and Applications"** - Wang et al
A comprehensive survey on methods for embedding knowledge graphs
**"Learning to Represent Knowledge Graphs with Gaussian Embedding"** - He et al
Discusses a method for embedding knowledge graphs using Gaussian distributions
**"Neural Text Generation from Structured Data with Application to the Biography Domain"**
Focuses on generating text from structured data, specifically in the biography domain
**"A Survey on Knowledge Graphs: Representation, Acquisition, and Applications"**
Provides an overview of knowledge graphs, including their representation and applications
**"Commonsense Knowledge in Word Embeddings and its Application to Sentence Generation"** - Speer et al
Examines how commonsense knowledge can be integrated into word embeddings for sentence generation
**"Graph Neural Networks: A Review of Methods and Applications"**
Reviews various methods and applications of graph neural networks, relevant for structured knowledge representation
**"Graph-to-Sequence Learning using Gated Graph Neural Networks"**
Discusses a method for generating sequences
**"Knowledge Graphs and Their Role in Natural Language Processing"**
Explores the role of knowledge graphs in NLP tasks, including NLG
**"Translating Embeddings for Modeling Multi-relational Data"** - Bordes et al
Introduces the TransE model for embedding multi-relational data in knowledge graphs

author.literal: **"A Survey on Neural Network-Based Summarization Methods"** - Dong et al.

title: Surveys various neural network approaches to text summarization, relevant for NLG
**"Towards a Universal Neural Sentence Encoder for Natural Language Understanding and Generation"** - Cer et al
Discusses a universal neural sentence encoder that can be used for both understanding and generating text
**"Knowledge Graph-Based Natural Language Generation"** - Koncel-Kedziorski et al
Focuses on generating natural language text using knowledge graphs
**"Neural Natural Language Generation: A Survey on Multilinguality, Multimodality, Controllability, and Learning"** - Gatt and Krahmer
A survey on various aspects of neural NLG, including the use of external knowledge

author.literal: **"End-to-End Neural Entity Linking"** - Kolitsas et al.

title: Discusses a method for linking entities in text to a knowledge base, which is crucial for integrating external knowledge into NLG
**"Pre-trained Models for Natural Language Processing: A Survey"**
Surveys various pre-trained models that are foundational for both knowledge representation and NLG

author.literal: **"Knowledge-Enhanced Neural Conversational Model"** - Zhou et al.

title: Explores how to enhance conversational models with external knowledge
**"Learning to Generate Natural Language from Structured Data with Abstract Meaning Representation"**
Discusses generating natural language from structured data using abstract meaning representation (AMR

These articles cover a broad range of topics related to knowledge representation and natural language generation, providing a solid foundation for understanding the current state of research in these areas
